docs.title: Welcome to My Notes
docs.text: This is a personal knowledge base built with MkDocs and hosted on GitHub Pages.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• 📝 Full Markdown support
  • ⚡ LaTeX math equations
  • 🎨 Syntax highlighting for code
  • 🏷️ Tag-based organization
  • 🔍 Powerful search functionality
  • 💬 Comments via Giscus
  • 📱 Mobile-friendly

docs.title: Getting Started with Notes
docs.text: Welcome to your new note-taking system! This guide will help you understand how to use all the features available.

docs.title: Basic Markdown
docs.text:
You can use all standard Markdown formatting:

  • Bold text using **double asterisks**
  • Italic text using *single asterisks*
  • Code using backticks
  • Links using [text](url)
  • Lists (like this one!)

docs.title: Math Equations
docs.text:
You can write LaTeX equations:

Inline equation: \(E = mc^2\)

Display equation:

\[ \frac{d}{dx}\left( \int_{0}^{x} f(u)\,du\right)=f(x) \]

docs.title: Code Blocks
docs.text:
def hello_world():
    print("Hello, fellow note-taker!")
    return True

docs.title: Task Lists
docs.text:
• Create a new note
  • Add some content
  • Include tags
  • Link to other notes

docs.title: Tags
docs.text:
Tags help organize your notes. Add them in the frontmatter like this:

---
title: Note Title
tags:
  - tag1
  - tag2
---

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
Notes are organized in categories:

docs/
├── categories/
│   ├── math/
│   ├── code/
│   └── general/
└── assets/
    └── images/

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
1. Use descriptive filenames
  2. Add tags to every note
  3. Include relevant links to other notes
  4. Keep notes atomic and focused
  5. Use headers for structure

docs.title: Basic Function
docs.text:
def fibonacci(n):
    """Return the nth Fibonacci number."""
    if n <= 1:
        return n
    return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2)

docs.title: Class Example
docs.text:
class Person:
    def __init__(self, name, age):
        self.name = name
        self.age = age

    def greet(self):
        return f"Hello, my name is {self.name}"

docs.title: Async Function
docs.text:
async function fetchData() {
    try {
        const response = await fetch('https://api.example.com/data');
        const data = await response.json();
        return data;
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error:', error);
    }
}

docs.title: DOM Manipulation
docs.text:
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
    const button = document.querySelector('#myButton');
    button.addEventListener('click', () => {
        alert('Button clicked!');
    });
});

docs.title: Derivatives
docs.text:
The derivative of a function represents its rate of change. For a function \(f(x)\), we write the derivative as \(f'(x)\) or \(\frac{d}{dx}f(x)\).

Some basic derivatives:

  1. \(\frac{d}{dx}(x^n) = nx^{n-1}\)
  2. \(\frac{d}{dx}(e^x) = e^x\)
  3. \(\frac{d}{dx}(\ln x) = \frac{1}{x}\)

docs.title: Integrals
docs.text:
The integral is the inverse operation of differentiation. The indefinite integral is written as:

\[ \int f(x)\,dx = F(x) + C \]

Where \(F'(x) = f(x)\) and \(C\) is the constant of integration.

docs.title: Problem 1
docs.text:
Find the derivative of \(f(x) = x^2\sin(x)\)

Solution:

Using the product rule:

\[ \begin{align*} f'(x) &= 2x\sin(x) + x^2\cos(x) \\ &= x(2\sin(x) + x\cos(x)) \end{align*} \]
